item.title: No title
item.description: Most things get better as you talk about them. Racism isn't one of them. Every time we talk about race, we breathe life into the idea that it matters. another breath into it  this even a question on this form. I'm reminded of Trevor Noah's hilarious account of how he had to choose his race when opening his first U.S. bank account. Coming from post-apartheid South Africa, where questions about race rarely appear on forms, Noah, who has a black mother and a white father, found himself debating with himself about whether to choose black or white.
